title: Magic Attendance and Probability
question_text: During the 2014-2015 season, the average home attendance for the Orlando Magic basketball team was 16 , 785 people. Suppose the distribution of attendance is normally distributed and that the standard deviation for the 2015 season was 432 people. If one home game was randomly selected from the 2014-2015 season, what is the probability that the attendance at that game was within 200 people of the overall average?
